name: Harbourmaster Hotel

reviews.text: The Harbourmaster is fulsomely praised in many guidebooks and magazine articles, and justifiably so. The owners, Glyn & Menna Heulyn, have got it just right.
reviews.title: Just Right!
The perfect romantic weekend hotel
reviews.text: The rooms are well-thought-out, individual, comfortable and stylish. Our bathroom was very spacious and luxurious. The location is excellent, right by the harbour, which you can sit and watch for hours.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights to celebrate our birthdays and were very impressed with hotel. The bedroom was great - gorgeous views over the harbour, very comfortable king sized bed, flat screen television and DVD player (with the option of borrowing a selection of DVDs for free from the hotel), with lovely Molton Brown bathroom products and snuggly bathrobes provided. The staff were all very friendly and efficient. Nothing bad to report with the food either - plenty of choice for breakfast with delicious local organic eggs, bacon and sausages and we enjoyed tasty steaks from the evening bar menu.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

description: The Harbourmaster on the quayside in Aberaeron offers you comfort in the most idyllic of locations. This listed landmark building reopened in June 2002 after extensive renovations. We have 13 individually-designed rooms in three historic buildings - all with harbour views. In 2008 the warehouse was opened, providing a further 4 rooms. A harbour facing suite with panoramic views, two west facing sea view terrace rooms and a town view room suitable for disabled use. (lift access to these new rooms) The Restaurant and new warehouse bar specialises in fresh local produce. Come and stay for a relaxing time and watch the tides wash in and out and the sun set over the bay!
